snippet: The Institute for Supply Management said its services index rose to 52.6 in July from 52.1 in June, beating economists’ forecasts of 52.
abstract: Report by the Institute for Supply Management finds that the service sector of the nation's economy edged up in July as new orders gained, even as sector employment fell to its lowest level in nearly a year.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management said its services index rose to 52.6 in July from 52.1 in June, beating economists’ forecasts of 52.

headline.seo: Services Sector Growth Rose Slightly in July
headline.main: Growth in Services Sector Rises, but a Gauge of Jobs Shrinks
headline.print_headline: Growth in Services Sector Rises, But a Gauge of Jobs Shrinks
